title: Southern Cross (debut 1976)
description:
Southern Cross were an Australian heavy rock band formed by ex-Buffalo members Alan Milano 

and John Baxter. Milano was co-vocalist on Dead Forever while John Baxter was 

responsible for Buffalo's heavy rock sound. By the time this recording came 

about Baxter had left to be replaced by Bruce Cumming. (via midoztouch)

After Buffalo some members went on to other projects. Peter Wells formed Rose 

Tattoo & had a distinguished solo career. Dave Tice went to the UK to join the 

Count Bishops & around 1981 returned to Australia to continue touring & 

recording as a solo artist & as a member of the Headhunters. He is currently 

playing in the Dave Tice Band & with ex AC/DC bassist Mark Evans as Tice & 

Evans. (see http://www.davetice.com) John (Jack The Riffer) Baxter played with 

Boy Racer & Southern Cross. Some material is believed to have been recorded but 

has never seen a release. Alan Milano was also a member of Southern Cross after 

leaving Buffalo after Dead Forever... (Wikipedia)


This album is very rare and it took me ages to find a decent version of it. I performed the remaster primarily through Sound Forge Pro version 10. I did 'tops and tails' (the songs begin and end right on the money and fade-outs are clean), removed pops and crackle, equalised it a bit further using Sony Xpress Graphic EQ (this sured up low bass and ultra trebles). Finally, I ran it through Audacity and levelled each song to -0.2dB (so there are no clips). Notably, on songs like 'Jesse' and 'Games', I used noise reduction in intros and outros if they were very quiet parts and the 'needle noise' was noticeable. Final files are FLAC 24-bit @ 96kHz.

Cheers,
Moofie Man
